alert.note: Alert for Effingham; Inland Bryan; Inland Chatham (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 6:30PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF BRYAN, EFFINGHAM AND CHATHAM COUNTIES... At 629 PM EDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Monteith to near Richmond Hill, and moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...strong winds 45 to 55 mph and up to penny sized hail. SOURCE...Radar Indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to plants, trees and crops is possible. Damage to windshields is unlikely. Some locations in the path of these storms include... Pooler, Richmond Hill, I-16/I-95 Interchange, Downtown Savannah, Godley Station, Savannah International Airport, Hunter Army Airfield and Garden City. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to flooding of low lying and poor drainage areas. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Report damage directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 888-383-2024 when it is safe to do so. You can also email your report to nws.charlestonsc@noaa.gov.
